stories.title: Rearchitecting Linux Storage Stack for µs Latency and High Throughput

stories.text:
I work as a devops guy new to the GIS space. I keep hearing how the current giant ESRI was worried about google entering the market with a GIS tool (like a professional google earth), but they never did.

I know they have the locations API, but they don't have a tool like qGIS or ArcGIS.

Does anyone have any insight as to why they didn't pursue entering the market?
stories.title: Ask HN: Why did Google leave the GIS space?
Australian High Court holds media liable for users' defamatory Facebook comments

stories.text:
I'm an average joe-schmoe programmer. Lately I've been wondering if there are any resources out there for people in tech to help solve meaningful, important problems that the world faces (eg. help find a cure for Cancer, fight climate change, etc.)

I discovered https://80000hours.org/ which seems to have a lot of resources, but seems more geared around picking a career to make an impact. I am happy with my career for the most part, but I would like to use my downtime to try and make a difference.
stories.title: Ask HN: Any way for everyday programmers to help solve important problems?
We Could Brighten Clouds to Cool the Earth
